# Rules of Conduct
At Nanotrasen, we trust our officers to act with the utmost dignity, reflecting their positions. This policy outlines the rules of conduct our valiant Security Force strives to uphold every day.
[bold]1.[/bold] Security Officers shall not violate the law which they uphold, and should they, must seek to improve and learn from their misdeeds.
[bold]2.[/bold] Security Officers shall not act against the interests of the Nanotrasen Corporation.
[bold]3.[/bold] Security Officers shall attempt to act with dignity and respect towards other employees.
[bold]4.[/bold] Security Officers shall ensure the welfare of any detainees in their care, providing needed medical care, food, and water, within reasonable bounds of request.
[bold]5.[/bold] Security Officers shall strive to protect Nanotrasen property, including employees.
[bold]6.[/bold] Security Officers shall not solicit or accept any bribes from any person or organization, in the form of funds or items.
[bold]7.[/bold] Security Officers shall not falsely report a crime or exaggerate details of a crime.
[bold]8.[/bold] Security Officers shall not be incompetent or negligent.
[bold]9.[/bold] Security Officers shall not drink to the point of being intoxicated, or otherwise engage in substances to the point of intoxication without medical preapproval.
[bold]10.[/bold] Security Officers shall not unduly interfere with station productivity.
[bold]11.[/bold] Security Officers shall not be absent from their duty assignments.
[bold]12.[/bold] Security Officers shall not be critical or talk negatively about other Nanotrasen, security officers, or any member of Command while on duty.
[bold]13.[/bold] Security Officers shall not join a workers' union or allow command members to form a union.
[bold]14.[/bold] Security Officers shall not smoke while not within a security office, or inside department bounds.
[bold]15.[/bold] Security Officers shall not give an opinion on any punishment to a crime, or whether the law should be enforced or not.
Failure to follow these Rules of Conduct may result in disciplinary action, or in termination, depending on the severity of the violation. All disciplinary actions or terminations may be made at the discretion of the Head of Security or the Captain.
